titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Florencio Saez was a professor of philosophy and church history at the Evangelical Seminary of Puerto Rico and a representative of the Dominican Schools of Puerto Rico at the World Convention of Dominican Schools. The Blanche Kellogg Institute was a school in Santurce, Puerto Rico run by the American Missionary Association.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a photograph album of the Presbyterian mission in Puerto Rico and the Blanche Kellogg Institute. Subjects of photographs include staff and students, mission buildings, churches, and landscapes. There are several loose photographs and newspaper clippings inserted in the volume.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
